title: My One Cent
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week fourteen that brought some electricity through the first five hours, with a little seeding fun decided on SNF. Yall don’t care about this intro though, you know what happened, so let’s get after it.

Week Fourteen Recap

Team Ross vs CalAmari Cooper:

Prediction: Team Ross by 22.3

Reality: Team Ross by 25.84

“Dmichs never had a chance” - Aross

“No comment on this past week” - Dmichs

I Got a Half Chubb vs United Nations:

Prediction: I Got a Half Chubb by 14.4

Reality: I Got a Half Chubb by 11.54

“Still hasn’t hit me that I’m not winning this league 3 years in a row” - MW

“I wanted to play Jarticus” - CJ

Nooni vs Pray for Ridley:

Prediction: Pray for Ridley by 32.2

Reality: Pray for Ridley by 17.3

“No thoughts” - Nooni

“Nooooooooniiiiii” - Bank

Real Brothers vs Team Horses:

Prediction: Team Horses by 65.4

Reality: Real Brothers by 37.4

“Sad!” - Folbe

“Happy! Call me Jart Back now, because Gart Follbe took my L” - Jart

NN vs Mike Williams WR1:

Prediction: NN by 26.6

Reality: NN by 51.08

“EZ clap, Brad was never a threat. He was a complete pretender all year who liked to bark a lot” - NN

“NN just different this time of year, nothing else needs to be said” - Brad

GRIDDY GANG vs Team ACL Tear:

Prediction: Team ACL Tear by 27.4

Reality: GRIDDY GANG by 6.12

“Only fitting higbee gets covid right before MNF really sums up my season and career in this league” - Jase

“Glad I lost. My boys need a wake up call before the ploffs. Also always a pleasure to battle with Jase” - JL

Transaction Analysis

Best Transaction: Rashaad Penny, $5, Jart. Pete didn’t lie.

Honorable Mention: Jalen Guyton, $5, Folbe. A nice pickup who scored a long touchdown, this one would’ve looked a lot better had Folbe started him.

Worst Transaction: Jermar Jefferson, $10, Bank. “Jefferson logged five offensive snaps but did not record a touch during Sunday's 38-10 loss to Denver.” - ESPN

Honorable Mention: Dallas Goedert, $2, Nooni. Not because Goedert is bad by any means. But because heading into the last week of the regular season, Nooni picked up a guy on bye. It was just weird. Also I wanted him and bid $1.

Record by Max PF

In this segment, we will be looking at what everyone’s record would be if we played best ball - where the higher max PF each week (best lineup) would win the H2H matchup even if those players were on the bench. *Record tiebreaker was by Max PF possible on season*

  1. JL (13-1) +1 Win
  2. NN (9-5) +1 Win
  3. Aross (8-6) -1 Win
  4. CJ (7-7) -1 Win

  6. Dmichs (7-7) No Change

League Takes

Agree:

-Playoffs are gonna get heated

-I want a 💍!!!!!

-Great league

-I want world peace

-Great competition this year, glad the top 6 teams made the yoffs

-I hate fantasy football

-I enjoyed your pitch about auction draft and I think I’m started to be persuaded

Neutral:

-Brad should go back to med school

-Playoffs won’t be the same without MW (MW)

Disagree:

-Let’s get next year going (Nooni)

Jart’s Mailbag

Who is going to win the B10 in basketball?

While it seemed early on that Purdue would be the easy answer, you’re not allowed to lose to Rutgers in a sport and win the conference. No one seems head and shoulders above the rest so it’s a bit of a crapshoot, but I’ll trust in Tom Izzo’s resume and ride with the Spartans. Go Green!

What’s everyone’s plans for Christmas?

CJ I never know when you ask these questions if you want me to just guess. But I’ll take a stab at what our 10 Jewish members are doing for Christmas. Which is probably nothing, since they’re, you know, Jewish. But here’s what I’ll guess they’re doing on December 25th.

  1. CJ: Fam’s meeting up on Shellmarr Ln. Kirstin and Kyle with the doggos as well.
  2. Bank: Taking a break from sticking his fingers in people’s butts to watch Hunter Renfrow highlights and all of James Conner’s touchdowns.
  3. JL: Thinking up new ways of how to tell us he is going to not win the league.
  4. Alex: Interviewing for head manager of the Padres organization now that he’s locked in.
  5. Folbe: Retiring from Amazon in Florida, with Anduril on the horizon.
  6. NN: Hitting the gym, guy is massive and takes no days off.
  7. Dmichs: Making sushi, working on some new stickers.
  8. Jase: Watching boxing.
  9. Brad: Going back to med school.
  10. MW: Working on those instagram posts with his dogs and for Sana Detroit.
  11. Nooni: Asking Dave why he likes auction drafts.

Is the league running back Boogie for the holidays?

Good question MW, my question for you is do you remember the first time yall went to Boogie? But I would guess no, although the league will probably get together and do something, just at a different venue instead.

What changes are coming to the league next year?

Probably not very many once the rubber hits the road, but I think we will see at least some change in how we currently do defenses and kickers. Whether that is eliminating them or adjusting scoring again, I think it will look different. With kickers this year we managed to eliminate a lot of the variance across the league (see the kicker scoring rankings), whereas defense left a much bigger gap. So I could see us shrinking the range of defensive scoring if we keep defenses. Beyond those two spots, I do think we will see a new roster spot this year, whether it be a FLEX or a Super FLEX. Tides seem to be moving in that direction, with a regular FLEX seeming more likely right now. I would be intrigued by how a tiered PPR system may operate (Example: .5 PPR for RBs, .75 for WRs, 1 for TEs), but that doesn’t seem likely for this upcoming season. I think we will probably end up sticking with a snake format sadly.

How many years does the Jart report see Dan Campbell lasting in Detroit?

I think it is wise to consider the roster in Detroit when considering Campbell’s longevity. It does not look like we will be drafting a guy we want to be the franchise QB this draft, so Campbell shouldn’t be judged off next year either. Assuming we get that player heading into Year 3 for Campbell (Bryce Young?), he will get 2 years to develop that and see if we can get something going. I think we do, and I think Campbell ultimately ends up being here around 7 years, leaving the team in better shape than it was when he took over. Good, but not elite. Think Caldwell era.

Can Kyler Murray see over his O-Line?

No.

If you had to power rank GMs by roster moves this year how would it look?

I will do this more in-depth this offseason so this is just a quick stab that I reserve the rights to change in a couple of months, but here are my initial thoughts:

  1. NN
  2. JL
  3. Jason
  4. Jart
  5. Alex
  6. CJ
  7. Dmichs
  8. Brad
  9. Folbe
  10. Bank
  11. MW
  12. Nooni

Top three favorite meals?

I am honestly not a huge foodie, I don’t make a ton of elaborate meals, so this is gonna be somewhat disappointing in all likelihood:

  1. Frita Batidos, double beef frita with the garlic cilantro fries and a coconut cream batido. Oof I miss that.
  2. My mom’s been making this fire pistachio encrusted salmon lately, that stuff’s different. Been pairing it with some unreal rolls too with the everything bagel seasoning from Trader Joes.
  3. Chicken pad thai from No Thai with crab rangoons. I’m in an Ann Arbor nostalgic mood.

League shooter power rankings? (Basketball) (Aross is 1)

  1. Alex
  2. CJ
  3. JL
  4. Folbe
  5. NN
  6. Jart
  7. Jason
  8. Nooni
  9. Dmichs
  10. Brad
  11. Bank
  12. MW

Who is your sleeper league winner player this year (an unexpected player that will put up numbers weeks 15-17 and propel his team to fantasy glory)?

Give me Nick Chubb. Kareem Hunt is injured, there’s some great matchups ahead, and he has flashed his 30 point potential earlier this season. Should get it started this week.

Best Value Later Draft Pick?

I think there are probably 4 potential choices here, and I will break them down from 4 to 1.

4. Cooper Kupp (46th overall, #1 WR): Obviously a phenomenal player, but went the earlier of any of the players listed here by a considerable amount, and plays Wide Receiver.

3. Deebo Samuel (90th overall, #3 WR): Wide receiver, sorry.

2. Leonard Fournette (92nd overall, #5 RB): What can be said? Never saw this coming.

1. James Conner (104th overall, #6 RB): Don’t get me started. Super happy for him, but has the most insane TD luck in the history of football at any level.

Best Value at Each Position:

QB: Tom Brady (82nd overall, #2 QB)

RB: Jonathan Taylor (13th overall, #1 RB)

WR: Deebo Samuel (90th overall, #3 WR)

TE: Mark Andrews (67th overall, #1 TE)

How is the league feeling about the snake-auction debate?

Upon polling the league, things are currently quite tight. As of this writing, the league is 7-5 split in favor of staying with a snake format. There are certainly some on the fence though, and as a well known proponent of the auction format I am excited to see how things continue to play out this offseason.

On To The Playoffs!

The Lopas Sportsbook Official Futures Odds:

JL +300

Aross +400

Jart +450

NN +500

Dmichs +550

CJ +650

Obviously, the worst value here is Jart, who has played erratic football, and needs to win three games to win the league. Considering Aross has essentially the same odds and only needs to win two, we like his value much better. If we were a betting man, we’d take JL, but we like the value on Dmichs as well. Expect the winner of JL-Dmichs to win the league.

The Byes

The 1 Seed, Jonah Lopas. In contention for the best regular season of all-time in this league, and should easily stroll to a championship this year. Can’t see anyone challenging him.

What The League Is Saying:

-Lopas 🐐

-Lopey is nice

-*Frick* Arob

-Lopas a fraud. (Not winning chip)

-Lopas has been GM of the year no doubt

-Not making it past the semis

-Good luck and don’t take this opportunity for granted

The 2 Seed, Alex Ross. While many have criticized the squad, he won the matchups in front of him, and what else can you ask? He’s not responsible for how his opponents do.

What The League Is Saying:

-Aross is a *female dog*

-Alex might be nicer than lopey

-Alex a fraud. (Not winning chip)

-Aross is in the playoffs?

-Not making it past the semis

-Aross got super lucky this year but is getting his roster together at the right time. If Lamar is hurt, hes donezo, but the combo of cook, jones, DK and possibly AJB makes him a tough out regardless. Much respect to a fellow league winner

-Good luck and don’t take this opportunity for granted

What The League Is Saying:

-Jart wins a close one

-Jart wins but CJ stays swift

-Jarrett finally getting hot at the right time. He’s going to run CJ off the field

-CJ due for a league win, think the lockout period he took is really turning out to be beneficial

-Sad to see such good buddies have to eliminate one another

-Jart has the better roster by far but has some tough matchups. If Penny and Saq continue being the 🛎 🐮 backs, it should be Jart by 10+. Go CJ

-Good luck and don’t take this opportunity for granted

CJ: I’m honored to be a part of this matchup with my OG

Jart: I am very excited to finally get to play Ceej in the playoffs. Should be a lot of fun, may the best team win. As long as that team is mine

What The League Is Saying:

-Dmichs will poo poo on nath

-NN wins cause the cowboys choke

-Daniel wins a close one which surprises most but not me. Daniel then goes on to beat Jonah

-NN by a million

-Noah’s team is fraudulent, gg Dmichs

-Super close matchup, both very talented rosters. I lean NN in this one as the stafford/kupp stack vs Seattle should be a solid edge over the Dak/Cooper stack. Jonathan Taylor is a tank but against the pats it could be a slow day for him. I like NN in a close one

-Good luck and don’t take this opportunity for granted

NN: EZ clap. Enough of all that nice talking. I’m coming for blood

Dmichs: Looking forward to a tough matchup with NN, should be a close one

Best Player at Each Position (Playoffs)

QB: Matt Stafford, NN

RB: Nick Chubb, CJ

WR: Cooper Kupp, NN

TE: Travis Kelce, Dmichs

D/ST: Bills D/ST, CJ

K: Matt Prater, Dmichs

Family Award (Playoffs)

For his triumphant first place PF finish to clinch a playoff spot and move all the way up to the 4 seed, NN is our Family Award winner this week. The boys are humming together, and although they will crash and burn against Dmichs this week, at least they made the playoffs.
